text:
It'd be great to have a JUnit4 task that provides all the features the JUnit task provides:

* Running a single test method.
* Running a test n times.

AFAIK these don't work with the test runner wrapper provided by JUnit4.
creator: bflat1@gmx.net

text:
How exactly does the current junit task not
work with junit4 as against junit3?
creator: peterreilly@apache.org

text:
we could certainly do with a complete junit4 test runner, although its home may
be better off inside junit itself. One thing ant cannot do is abandon junit3
compatibility; this would be a new junit4 task in a new junit4 antlib.

As such, we would welcome code, doc and test contributions from developers who
use junit4 and would benefit from the task.
creator: stevel@apache.org
bflat1@gmx.net
text:
Peter: I'm currently trying to verify it, but think the execution properties:

<sysproperty key="junit.test.method"      		 value="${method}"/>
<sysproperty key="junit.test.times"        		 value="${times}"/>

are not honored for JUnit4 tests, with "method" being the more important one.

creator: bflat1@gmx.net
text: Sorry, I just learnt these are features we provide in our own TestSuite class, so we should be able to remedy this by providing our own custom test runner for JUnit4. I'm sorry about the confusion.

creator: peterreilly@apache.org
text:
Thanks for looking into it.
